description.narrative: Plastic recycling management program to minimize negative impacts and risks to environmental and human health in India through a socio-technical model

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.Number of policies and programme promoting sustainable livelihoods and incorporating gender responsive strategies for natural resources and ecosystems management 2. Number of scalable initiatives incorporating improved management of ozone depleting substances, chemicals and/or wastes

comment.narrative: 1.Surveys, meetings, selection process, risk assessment and local legal agreements with NGOs in 12 new cities as part of expansion 2. Stabilization and performance monitoring of 13 cities to enhance recycling rates. 3. Rollout of technology apps in all the 25 cities including government and recycling partners 4. Carrying out baseline activities for bench-marking in all the 25 cities 5. SHGs formed 15 per city (15x25=375). 6. Collection of 110-100 Mts per month per city on average (100x25x12=30,000) 7. Two meetings with stakeholders in each City per months (25x2x12=600) 8. Swachhata Kendras established in 20 cities

1. The project has been expanded to 16 new cities after due diligence, financial and technical evaluations and field visits. 29 implementing partners have been on-boarded till December 2019. 2. Recycling rates have been enhanced across 15 cities through direct partnerships with municipal corporations. 3. Technology app successfully rolled out in 11 cities 4. Baseline activities undertaken in 18 cities and 10 more are in process 5. 84 SHGs have been linked through 18 implementing partners 6. Till November 2019, 24,325 mts of all types of plastic has been collected by 22 implementing partner and 12 enterprise partners. 7. More than 1188 meetings with stakeholders such as municipal corporations, CSOs, NGOs, volunteers, corporate partners, citizen groups, self-help groups of waste pickers, recyclers, schools, colleges, waste collectors, municipal contractors, panchayats, municipal councils and other urban local bodies have been conducted. 8. Swachhata Kendras established in 19 cities.

HCCB: 1) Surveys, meetings, selection process, risk assessment and local legal agreements with NGOs in 12 new cities as part of expansion as we are already in 28 cities. Hence a total of 40 cities to be reached this year. 2) Stabilization and performance monitoring of 40 cities to enhance recycling rates 3) Rollout of data recording digital tools in all the 40 cities including government and recycling partners 4) Set up Swachhta Kendras, collection, segregation and link to recyclers in 35 Cities/35 centres; may be two or three in a city 5) Collection of 70 MT per month per city on average (70x12x40=33,600), collections from special Partners is 45,000. Hence total of 68,000 tons is the target for the year 2021 6) Two meetings with stakeholders in each City over months (approx. 660 meetings across 12 months) 7) New partnerships, five developed in waste management; behavioural change and Monitoring
HUL: 1) 1,02,083 no. of units to be onboarded. (residential, commercial, institutional etc.) 2) Collection and Disposal of approximately 3,560 MTs of plastic waste at the Swachhta Kendra in Mumbai. 3) Inclusion of 450 more Safai Saathis and linking them with Utthaan Programme 4) Operationalizing one more Swachhta Kendra in Mumbai to achieve the target of 4 Swachhta Kendra in the project 5) Conduct Baseline Survey for G-South ward 6) Establishing atleast 3 new enterprise partnerships in the city 7) 4 Plastic Lao Mask Pao Campaign to create awareness on waste segregation and plastic waste recycling 8) MPCB CTE/CTO certification for all 4 Swachhta Kendra 9) Weighbridge installation and pending machineries at 4 Swachhta Kendra 10) Goods and Stocks Insurance for 3 Swachhta Kendra 11) Conduct awareness sessions/webinars with schools, colleges, resident welfare associations (RWAs): approximately 30 12) Organizing Recyclers Consultation to establish linkages with PCB registered entities 13) Organizing medical health camps for Safai Saathis, quarterly one camp at all 4 Swachhta Kendra
HDFC Bank: 1) Establishment of Swachhta Kendra in 3 cities 2) Collection, Segregation and processing of approximately 2,000 MT of dry waste at the Swachhta Kendra 3) Onboarding of approximately 300 waste pickers into the project 4) Social inclusion activities to be carried out for approximately 270 waste pickers engaged with the project 5) Safety measures such as dress, gloves and other equipment to be distributed to 300 waste pickers 6) Awareness programs in schools/colleges/other institutions to be carried out: 20 7) Approximately 20 trainings/meetings to be organized for waste pickers engaged in the project
CCIF: 1) 3 periodic Meeting with the ULB on project progress 2) Fully functional Swachhta Kendra in 3 cities 3) Collection, Segregation and processing of approximately 2500 MTs of plastic waste at the Swachhta Kendra 4) Onboarding & mainstreaming of approximately 150 waste pickers in to the project and recognition of their service to the society as per the Solid waste management rules 2016 of Govt of India 5) Social inclusion & livelihood activities to be carried out for formalization of the informal waste management service provider across the waste value chain 6) Safety measures such as dress, gloves and other equipment to be distributed to 150 waste pickers 7) 2 meetings with stakeholders in each city over 10 months 8) Behavioural change & monitoring systems set up in each city 9) 3 SHGs to be formed in each city
CTSI (Nayara Energy): 1) 2 cities & 15 villages consent from ULB & Rural authority to initiate the project in the identified domain 2) Baseline study conducted in 2 cities & 15 villages 3) 10 IEC activities on source segregation to be conducted in each of the 2 cities 4) Source segregation practices initiated in 2 cities & 15 villages 5) Segregation shed setup& initiate operation in 10 villages 6) 10 spot beautification/wall paintings activities conducted 7) 10 SHG formed across the 2 cities & 15 villages in 10 month duration 8) 1 Swachhta Kendra setup at Khambalia 9) 100 Safai Sathis, waste workers to be onboarded 10) Data mapping & Monitoring system set up in 2 cities & 15 villages 11) A pilot study on RVM to be conducted initially with 2 RVM, Only on successful result of the pilot total 20 RVM to be installed at various locations.

HCCB: 1) Reached 31 cities 2) Achieved in 22 cities. 3) In progress 4) Completed in 22 cities 5) Total tonnage achieved as of end of Q3 is 22,775 MTs. 6) Conducted more than 190 stakeholder meetings 7) Achieved more than 6 new partnerships
HDFC Bank: 1) One SK established at SDMC, others are in process 2) 3,247.76 MTs 3) 425 Safai Sathis onboarded 4) 300 Safai Sathis engaged 5) More than 350 Safai Sathis 6) 55 7) 113
CCIF: 1)10 periodic Meeting with the ULB on project progress conducted 2) All 3 Swachhta Kendra are functional in all 3 cities 3)Collection, Segregation and processing of 2,069 MTs of plastic waste at the Swachhta Kendra 4) 268 waste picker onboarded and mainstreamed 5)10 Social inclusion & livelihood activities to be carried out for formalization of the informal waste management service provider across the waste value chain 6) Safety measures such as dress, gloves and other equipment to be distributed to 90 waste pickers 7) 2 meetings with stakeholders in each city over 10 months 8) In Progress 9) 4 SHGs formed other are in progress
CTSI (Nayara Energy): 1) Achieved 2) Achieved 3) More than 10 IEC activities conducted on source segregation in 1 city & 15 villages, 2nd city activities are in progress 4) Source segregation practices initiated in 1 city and 11 villages, others are in progress 5) In progress 6) In progress 7) In progress 8) In progress 9) 98 Safai Sathis, waste workers onboarded till October end 10)Data mapping & Monitoring system set up in 2 cities & 15 villages 11)10 RV installation in Progress
HUL: 1) 33,375 units onboarded. Awareness and outreach initiatives for onboarding impacted hugely due to covid 2) 2,687 MTs 3) 521 Safai Sathis 4) Completed, G South centre operational. 5) In Progress 6) 2 partnerships done, third will be issued in the next 2 weeks’ time. Proposals received from the bidders. 7) Completed 8) 3 centres, 4th centre will happen next year. 9) Partially done for 3 centres. 10) In progress 11) 42 12) Dialogue initiated with MPCB. Postponed to first quarter of 2022 because of CPCB SoPs and change of team at MPCB. 13) Completed

Hindustan Coca Cola Beverages Partnership
1.Surveys, meetings, selection process, risk assessment and local legal agreements with NGOs in 12 new cities as part of expansion as we are already in 28 Cities 2. Stabilization and performance monitoring of 34 cities to enhance recycling rates. 3. Rollout of technology apps in all the 40 cities including government and recycling partners 4. Set up Swachta Kendras, collection, segregation and link to recyclers in 35 Cities/35 centres; may be two or three in a city. 5. Collection of 70 MT per month per city on average (34,000 MT per year) 6. Two meetings with stakeholders in each City per months (approximately 880 meetings across 12 months) 7. New partnerships, five developed in waste management; behavioral change and Monitoring.
Hindustan Unilever Partnership
1. 100% segregation of dry waste at household level (behaviour change): 66488 households 2. Collection of approximately 40000 tons of plastic waste at the Swachhta Kendra in Mumbai 3. Operationalizing total of 4 Swachhta Kendra in Mumbai 4. Decentralized processing of approximately 3418 tons of plastic waste in Mumbai 5. Inclusion of 354 Safai Sathis in Mumbai 6. Developing 5 additional institutional partnerships in the city 7. Establishing 3 new enterprise partnerships in the city 8. Conduct 2 stakeholder workshops in Mumbai 9. Establish linkages with 10 additional authorized recyclers 10. Conduct awareness sessions with schools, colleges, resident welfare associations (RWAs): approximately 45
HDFC Partnership
1. Baseline study to be carried out in 3 cities 2. Establishment of Swachhta Kendra in 3 cities 3. Collection, segregation and processing of approximately 3000 MT of plastic waste at the Swachhta Kendra 4. Onboarding of approximately 300 waste pickers in to the project 5. Social inclusion activities to be carried out for approximately 270 waste pickers engaged with the project 6. Safety measures such as dress, gloves and other equipment to be distributed to 300 waste pickers 7. Awareness programs in schools/colleges/other institutions to be carried out: 20 8. Approximately 20 trainings/meetings to be organized for waste pickers engaged in the project

Hindustan Coca Cola Beverages Partnership
1. Project currently has presence in 30 cities. 6 more cities to be added as revised target 2. Stabilization and performance monitoring of 34 cities to enhance recycling rates has been completed 3. Rollout of technology apps in all the 40 cities including government and recycling partners is under process and will be completed by mid 2021 4. Swachhta Kendras have been set up in 30 cities 5. 23,077 MT has been collected so far (October 2020) 6. 600 stakeholder meetings conducted 7. 6 new partnerships developed in waste management
Hindustan Unilever Limited Partnership:
1. 100% segregation of dry waste at household level (behavioural change): 17,661 households 2. Collection of approximately 1481.70 tonnes of plastic waste at the Swachhta Kendra in Mumbai 3. Decentralized processing of approximately 1,037.19 tons of plastic waste in Mumbai 4. Inclusion of 336 Safai Sathis in Mumbai 5. No new partnerships were developed however there are a few in pipeline 6. No new enterprise partnerships were created but there are a few in pipeline 7. Conducted 1 stakeholder workshop in Mumbai 8. Linkages with additional authorized recyclers is in process
HDFC Partnership 1. The baseline study will be completed by end December, 2020 2. Swachhta Kendras established in Panaji, Rishikesh, Delhi Cantonement and Dehradun 3. 1492.77 MTs of dry waste collected till October 2020 4. 224 waste pickers onboarded 5. Social inclusion activities carried out for 150 Safaii Sathiis 6. Due to Covid-19, all Safai Sathiis associated with the project were provided safety gear 7. 6 awareness programs conducted with 1045 households, however, due to COVID -19 no programs could be conducted in schools and colleges 8. 138 trainings/meetings conducted

Hindustan Unilever Limited: 1) 6,400 MTs of plastic waste to be processed 2) 200 Safai Sathis to be onboarded under HUL & 3,000 under project Utthaan 3) 3 workshops to be conducted for increased capacities of participants including gender sensitization & PSEA 4) 100,000 households to be onboarded for capacity building on source segregation and collection of waste. 5) 4 inclusive Swachhta Kendras facilities to be set up 6) 3 workshops for awareness and capacity building of stakeholders 7) 1 white paper to be developed highlighting the pre- & post-interventions of UNDP, enhancing social protection for Safai Sathis. 8) 4 training programmes to be conducted for project implementation 9) 6 (under project Utthaan) community mobilizers to be trained.
Coca Cola India Foundation: 1) 3,000 MTs of plastic waste to be processed 2) 200 Safai Sathis to be onboarded 3) 3 workshops to be conducted for increased capacities of participants including gender sensitization & PSEA 4) 3,000 households to be onboarded for capacity building on source segregation and collection of waste. 5) 3 inclusive Swachhta Kendras facilities to be set up 6) 3 workshops for awareness and capacity building of stakeholders 7) 1 training programmes to be conducted for project implementation
Nayara Energy: 1) 600 MTs of plastic waste to be processed 2) 200 Safai Sathis to be onboarded 3) 2 workshops to be conducted for increased capacities of participants including gender sensitization & PSEA 4) 5,000 households to be onboarded for capacity building on source segregation and collection of waste. 5) 1 inclusive Swachhta Kendras facilities to be set up 6) 2 workshops for awareness and capacity building of stakeholders 7) 1 training programmes to be conducted for project implementation
Hindustan Coca Cola Beverages: 1) 67,840 MTs of plastic waste to be processed 2) 9,000 Safai Sathis to be onboarded
HDFC Bank: 1) 3,000 MTs of plastic waste to be processed 2) 150 Safai Sathis to be onboarded
